content.raw:
Running Jose's issue_662 branch with `ulimit -c unlimited` and the following command:
~~~
while DISPLAY=asdf ./test/regression/ray_sensor_issue662 2> foo ; do cat foo; done
~~~
I got the following backtrace, which occurs after our test has finished ServerFixture::Unload:
~~~
Program received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.
0x00007ffff4d05fde in ?? () from /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6
(gdb) bt
#0  0x00007ffff4d05fde in ?? () from /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6
#1  0x00007ffff4d08a45 in malloc () from /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6
#2  0x00007ffff530eded in operator new(unsigned long) ()
   from /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libstdc++.so.6
#3  0x00007ffff52f7a89 in std::string::_Rep::_S_create(unsigned long, unsigned long, std::allocator<char> const&) ()
   from /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libstdc++.so.6
#4  0x00007ffff52f87fb in std::string::_Rep::_M_clone(std::allocator<char> const&, unsigned long) () from /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libstdc++.so.6
#5  0x00007ffff52f88e0 in std::string::reserve(unsigned long) ()
   from /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libstdc++.so.6
#6  0x00007ffff52f19dc in std::basic_stringbuf<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> >::overflow(int) ()
   from /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libstdc++.so.6
#7  0x00007ffff52f6085 in std::basic_streambuf<char, std::char_traits<char> >::xsputn(char const*, long) () from /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libstdc++.so.6
#8  0x00007ffff52e2bd5 in std::ostreambuf_iterator<char, std::char_traits<char> > std::num_put<char, std::ostreambuf_iterator<char, std::char_traits<char> > >::_M_insert_int<long long>(std::ostreambuf_iterator<char, std::char_traits<char> >, std::ios_base&, char, long long) const ()
   from /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libstdc++.so.6
#9  0x00007ffff52e2e36 in std::num_put<char, std::ostreambuf_iterator<char, std::char_traits<char> > >::do_put(std::ostreambuf_iterator<char, std::char_traits<char> >, std::ios_base&, char, long long) const ()
   from /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libstdc++.so.6
#10 0x00007ffff52edbed in std::ostream& std::ostream::_M_insert<long long>(long long) () from /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libstdc++.so.6
#11 0x000000000046629a in testing::internal::PrettyUnitTestResultPrinter::OnTestEnd(testing::TestInfo const&) ()
#12 0x000000000045bc8d in testing::internal::TestEventRepeater::OnTestEnd(testing::TestInfo const&) ()
#13 0x00000000004712b4 in testing::TestInfo::Run() ()
#14 0x0000000000471497 in testing::TestCase::Run() ()
#15 0x00000000004717fe in testing::internal::UnitTestImpl::RunAllTests() ()
#16 0x00000000004719f7 in testing::UnitTest::Run() ()
#17 0x0000000000436acf in main ()
(gdb)
~~~
content.html:
Running Jose's issue_662 branch with ulimit -c unlimited and the following command:

while DISPLAY=asdf ./test/regression/ray_sensor_issue662 2> foo ; do cat foo; done

I got the following backtrace, which occurs after our test has finished ServerFixture::Unload:

Program received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.
0x00007ffff4d05fde in ?? () from /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6
(gdb) bt
#0  0x00007ffff4d05fde in ?? () from /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6
#1  0x00007ffff4d08a45 in malloc () from /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6
#2  0x00007ffff530eded in operator new(unsigned long) ()
   from /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libstdc++.so.6
#3  0x00007ffff52f7a89 in std::string::_Rep::_S_create(unsigned long, unsigned long, std::allocator<char> const&) ()
   from /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libstdc++.so.6
#4  0x00007ffff52f87fb in std::string::_Rep::_M_clone(std::allocator<char> const&, unsigned long) () from /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libstdc++.so.6
#5  0x00007ffff52f88e0 in std::string::reserve(unsigned long) ()
   from /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libstdc++.so.6
#6  0x00007ffff52f19dc in std::basic_stringbuf<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> >::overflow(int) ()
   from /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libstdc++.so.6
#7  0x00007ffff52f6085 in std::basic_streambuf<char, std::char_traits<char> >::xsputn(char const*, long) () from /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libstdc++.so.6
#8  0x00007ffff52e2bd5 in std::ostreambuf_iterator<char, std::char_traits<char> > std::num_put<char, std::ostreambuf_iterator<char, std::char_traits<char> > >::_M_insert_int<long long>(std::ostreambuf_iterator<char, std::char_traits<char> >, std::ios_base&, char, long long) const ()
   from /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libstdc++.so.6
#9  0x00007ffff52e2e36 in std::num_put<char, std::ostreambuf_iterator<char, std::char_traits<char> > >::do_put(std::ostreambuf_iterator<char, std::char_traits<char> >, std::ios_base&, char, long long) const ()
   from /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libstdc++.so.6
#10 0x00007ffff52edbed in std::ostream& std::ostream::_M_insert<long long>(long long) () from /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libstdc++.so.6
#11 0x000000000046629a in testing::internal::PrettyUnitTestResultPrinter::OnTestEnd(testing::TestInfo const&) ()
#12 0x000000000045bc8d in testing::internal::TestEventRepeater::OnTestEnd(testing::TestInfo const&) ()
#13 0x00000000004712b4 in testing::TestInfo::Run() ()
#14 0x0000000000471497 in testing::TestCase::Run() ()
#15 0x00000000004717fe in testing::internal::UnitTestImpl::RunAllTests() ()
#16 0x00000000004719f7 in testing::UnitTest::Run() ()
#17 0x0000000000436acf in main ()
(gdb)
